questions.question_text: What two steps are required to visualize API connectivity and enable API protection in VMware Tanzu Service Mesh? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. Activate API Discovery for the Global Namespace
B. Create API Security Policy for the Global Namespace

choices.A: Virtual Machine Service, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid and Cluster API
choices.D: VMware Tanzu Mission Control Connection agent, Cluster API and Kubernetes Connection Agent
choices.B: Authentication webhook, Container Storage Support, Cloud Provider Implementation
choices.C: Aria integration Service, Tanzu Cluster API and Tanzu Container Network Controller

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Virtual Machine Service: This layer handles the underlying infrastructure and virtual machine management. 
Tanzu Kubernetes Grid: This layer is responsible for the Tanzu Kubernetes Grid service itself, including provisioning and managing Tanzu Kubernetes clusters. 
Cluster API: This layer utilizes the Cluster API to manage the lifecycle of the Tanzu Kubernetes clusters.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-4D0D375F-C001-4F1D-AAB1-1789C5577A94.html

The Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Service exposes three layers of controllers to manage the lifecycle of a Tanzu Kubernetes cluster.

1.The Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Service
2. The Cluster API 
3. The Virtual Machine Service

Answer is B
Authentication webhook, Container Storage Support, Cloud Provider Implementation

B. Authentication webhook, Container Storage Support, Cloud Provider Implementation
Please ignore the below one which I mentioned as A

A. Virtual Machine Service, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid and Cluster API

questions.question_text:
The Supervisor Service in Tanzu Kubernetes Grid exposes three layers of controllers to manage the lifecycle of a Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster.
Which layer of controllers is correct?
Which two Kubernetes Service types are fulfilled natively by Kubernetes without requiring external integrations? (Choose two.)
What is the Kubernetes component that is responsible for workload creation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Option A. If the question is about the component responsible for creation. Scheduler finds suitable node for placement. Similarly, kublet is a node agent responsible for ensuring containers within a pod are healthy on a specific node as per their desired state. 

The API server processes requests to create and manage workloads. 
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/

Option D. Question is about component responsible for creation. Scheduler only find a suitable node for placement. But it is kubelet which watches for requests for running pods and runs them on the node designated by scheduler.
kubelet : Watches for requests to run pods and starts the pods on the worker node.
I agree with the anonymous contributor. Answer should be "B. Scheduler". Please review k8s documentation: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/kube-scheduler/#kube-scheduler

questions.question_text: Which two methods can be used to install Fluent Bit on a VMware Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C. Install Fluent Bit from VMware Tanzu Mission Control
E. Install Fluent Bit using Tanzu CLI package plugin
